Fields.DialogueText: Kapitän, Nixen are approaching our stern. They're moving fast. What should we do?
Don't worry about it, Kapitän. I sensed them a while ago.
Why shouldn't I worry?
Let's just say they'll be blown to pieces long before they get a shot off at us.

Fields.MenuText: I like the sound of that.
The way you're smiling is worrying me.
I'm going to need a bit more of an explanation.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought you might. Who doesn't love a nice surprise?
If I had a Reichsmark for every time I heard that, I'd be rich.
Just be patient, Kapitän. It'll be worth it.
Captain, they're getting closer.
Nürnberg...
*BOOM*
What was that?
Hehehe! Surprise! Hab ich dich!
Looks as if a few of the Nixen sailed straight into a minefield. But a couple are still afloat. They're still approaching, Captain.
What? Those mines were packed with enough explosives to turn an elephant inside out!
Sound the alarm! Morganas are a little larger than elephants, Nürnberg. Keep that in mind next time.
@BATTLE
What's that you're working on, Nürnberg? It doesn't look like your Wanderbuch.
Oh, uh, nein. It's not. I decided to begin a new project.
Mein Wanderbuch represents my past, and that's important to me, but I want to look to the future. Start with a new, fresh slate, as it were.

Fields.MenuText: That sounds like a good idea to me.
So... we went through all that trouble for nothing?
What will you call this new book of yours?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad you agree, Kapitän.
No, of course not. My book will always have a special place in my heart. And on my bedside table. I'd have been devastated if I'd lost it for good.
Erm... Wanderbuch Zwei?
You know, I haven't been able to write a single word, so far. All I have to do is account for my travels and experiences, but I'm experiencing a bit of a block.
You have writer's block? That can't be fun.
It's not. I can't even come up with a good quote for my first page. It's so aggravating!
*ALARM*
And if that wasn't enough...
Well, at least now I can blow off a little steam.
@BATTLE
So... they still hate me.
Still trying to patch things up with the medical officers?
Ja, but I'm still not getting much more than one-word answers. Maybe I should give them some space.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe. They say time heals all wounds.
Or you could smother them until they love you. That's what I always do.
Just stare at them until they decide to open up.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose a little patience wouldn't hurt.
I have to say, that sounds like a horrible plan, Kapitän.
While I'm sure that would entertain you, I'm not sure that's the answer to my problem.
You know, I could always talk to them, try and convince them to be a little more amiable.
I appreciate that, but this is something I have to do on my own.
I understand. Just try to keep the ship in one piece. The last thing I need is to be captain of a ship divided.
Das glaube ich gern. And that's the last thing I want, I promise.
*ALARM*
A Morgana attack also ranks pretty high on the list of last things I need.
We should compare lists sometime. They seem to be pretty similar.
@BATTLE
Well, it looks as if we've received a new assignment, Nürnberg.
Ja? It's about time. Something exciting, I hope?
I'm not sure. We've been ordered to return to port for further instructions.
We should hurry, then. This could be the first adventure I write about in my new Wanderbuch.

Fields.MenuText: Have you decided on a quote for the first page, yet?
Or it could be the sort of assignment we could do in our sleep.
Hell, it could be so amazing that you'll write a whole trilogy about it.

Fields.DialogueText: Um, not quite. But I still have time. Nothing to worry about.
Stop spitting into my soup, Kapitän. I'm looking forward to this.
Oh, I hope not. I don't think I have that kind of time. We're fighting a war after all.
Oh nein, we have company heading our way, Kapitän.
Morganas?
What else? I'll get the alarm going. We're going to have a fight on our hands.
@BATTLE
Nürnberg, do you want some pancakes?
Äh, nein danke. Pfannkuchen is a little sweet for my tastes.

Fields.MenuText: They aren't my favorites either, but it was a nice surprise in the mess today.
What?! How can you not like pancakes?
They're okay. I prefer waffles, though.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, maybe I'll have a bite later. If only to add a little variety to my diet.
They're just not my treat of choice. There are far better options.
I suppose I don't mind Waffeln now and then.
So what do you like, then?
Lebkuchen. All day, every day. Ginger, notes of citrus, maybe dipped in a bit of chocolate? It's heavenly.
That's usually a Christmas treat, isn't it?
Traditionally, yes. But that won't stop me from eating two or twelve of them any time I come across a tin of them.
I'll keep that in mind.
*ALARM*
Oh, how did those Nixen sneak up on us?!
Maybe you were too busy drooling over a certain ginger cookie?
I wasn't drooling. But could you blame me if I was? They're the best!
@BATTLE
Kapitän, we have Morganas on all sides. They're surrounding us.
If that's the case... why are you smiling like that?
Nadürlich, I have something up my sleeve. I'm just asking for permission to take a few risks.

Fields.MenuText: You know I give you quite a bit of leeway in this department.
Not too many risks. Explaining that sort of behavior to Command after the fact is never pleasant.
Risks? Do you have to?

Fields.DialogueText: And I can't tell you how happy that leeway makes me.
Well, okay. I'll try and keep the risk-taking to a minimum.
Nein, I don't have to. But it'd make me very happy if I could.
Just give me more of a heads up in the future, all right?
Somebody doesn't like surprises.
No. Somebody does not.
Also gut, na schön. I'll go ahead and unpack. Nearby, there's a shallow area.
Were we to lead the Nixen in the right direction, some of them might find themselves run aground. Which means fewer for us to fight.
Ah, clever, Nürnberg.
Danke - I like to think so. But we'll have to be careful not to run aground ourselves. Hence, the risks.
I think we'll be able to handle ourselves.
Perfect. Let's be on our way, then. The longer we talk, the closer the Nixen get.
Lead the way.
@BATTLE
@BATTLE
Finally, port. We were gone for too long, Kapitän. The sea is nice, but I was starting to miss the view of the countryside.

Fields.MenuText: Really? I'd take the ocean over land any day of the week.
Yeah, I need to walk on good, solid ground every once in a while.
It wasn't that long. You lightweight.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, I like the ocean too, but Deutschland is my home. The land and the people are far more important to me.
You're right - it doesn't get any more solid than Deutschland. We've got the sturdiest ground you'll find in the world.
I suppose I'm just too attached to Deutschland, then. Because it's felt like forever since I felt this close.
We all know you adore Germany, Nürnberg. You don't have to be dramatic about it.
I'm not being dramatic, I'm just saying what I feel, Kapitän.
Well, if you want, you can go to the dock. We might be here a while.
No sign of the admiral yet?
No. I think he means to make us wait.
Fine by me. More time with my Vaterland.
Morganas off the beam. Battle stations!
Kapitän, you received a letter. It's marked urgent.

Fields.MenuText: Excuse me, did I say you could come in?
Does it say who it's from?
Thank you.

Fields.DialogueText: Uh, no, I, uh... It's urgent so I assumed...
Well, you assumed wrong. I could've been naked in here! Just leave the letter and get out!
Um... from, Urgent? That's all it says.
Well, that's very unhelpful.
It's my pleasure, Kapitän.
Here you are. My apologies for the interruption.
It must be from the admiral. Let's hope it has good news for us.
All right... interesting.
I wonder how Nürnberg is going to feel about this. It might be a stretch for her.
*ALARM*
Morganas? It's like someone put a "kick me" sign on our stern.
Kapitän, we have--
I heard. Let's blow up some Morganas.
@BATTLE
Kapitän? You called for me?
Yes. I received our next assignment. Wanted to keep you informed.
Did the admiral stop by? I didn't notice him.
No, he sent a letter. Apparently, he had more important matters to attend to.
He is a busy man.

Fields.MenuText: He does have important work to do.
Busy or not, I do not like that guy.
We're all busy. This is war.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't even want to think about the amount of pressure an admiral must be under. *shudder*
How do you know? You don't see him enough to have an accurate opinion of his character.
You make a good point. I would hope that none of us are lazing about.
So what's our next mission, Kapitän?
Some allies of ours have been fending off Morgana attacks for some time now. They've asked for aid, and we've been assigned the mission.
Blowing up more Nixen always sounds good to me.
We also have to deal with maintaining good relations with these allies. Our relationship is... rocky, to say the least.
Oh, so these are those "allies" who blame everything that happened in the last war on Deutschland.
Now, I know you've had trouble in the past with keeping the peace on this ship. Is this going to be an issue?
I'm... I'm working on it. I'm trying to keep a slightly more open mind now. You know that.
That didn't answer my question.
Ich kann damit umgehen. I'll make it work.
That's what I wanted to hear.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Nürnberg, are you okay? You're practically steaming.
I'm just... I'm trying to... do you think you could handle all the talking with this new assignment? I don't want to accidentally ruin anything.

Fields.MenuText: You're the Belle. They're going to want to see you.
For the most part, I think I'll be able to handle the talking. But if I need you, you'll need to be prepared to interact with our allies.
Calm down. You're not going to ruin anything.

Fields.DialogueText: I was afraid you'd say that. Why? There's nothing all that special about me. We Walküren are basically all the same.
I suppose that's better than nothing.
You don't know that. I could say something without thinking and start a mini-war without even trying.
Warum mache ich das? This is not going to be fun.
Nürnberg, you can do this.
I'm not sure why you're so confident. I still haven't been able to smooth things over with the medical staff.
But the situation's better than it used to be, right?
Kind of. They're using whole sentences to speak with me now. Most of the time.
See? Progress.
You're sure there's no way we could just pass this assignment onto someone else? It doesn't have to be us, does it?
*ALARM*
Oh, perfect! Just what I need, a distraction. I'm thinking about this way too much. I forgot how aggravating trying to please everyone can be.
Oh, good grief.
@BATTLE
*snort*
I'd suggest you not snort in front of our allies, Kapitän.
All right, looks like we're ready to head out, Kapitän. We should have everything we need.
Just in time, too. If it had taken us any longer, I'm not sure we would have made it in time.
I want to say I could think of worse things, but that wouldn't be right of me. If we don't complete our assignment, people will suffer.

Fields.MenuText: Look at you, putting yourself in other people's shoes.
Having trouble keeping an open mind there, Nürnberg?
Yes, congratulations. You realized that people suffering is a bad thing.

Fields.DialogueText: Danke, Kapitän. I like to think that I'm doing better.
I'm just trying to... think a little more. Keep some of my more selfish tendencies from popping up.
That's not what I meant, Kapitän. I just... I don't know. I'm trying to be better here.
*ALARM*
You know, in the past, I would have wanted to lie in wait and strike at the Nixen while they were attacking the city. Trap them in a place where they would be unable to run.
Wouldn't that leave the city in a bad situation?
Ja, de Stadt wär beschosse und geblündert worde. Lives would have been lost. I would have called it the price of war.
Let's try and think up a plan with fewer potential casualties.
@BATTLE
Of course, Kapitän.
*ALARM*
Kapitän, what smells delicious in here?

Fields.MenuText: Oh... a special treat I found...
Just the diesel fuel smell of a submarine. It becomes like a perfume to all of us after a while.
Smell? Why, whatever do you mean?

Fields.DialogueText: A special treat? Care to elaborate?
That's not the smell I meant, and you know it.
Don't play coy with me, Kapitän. You're not a good actor.
Seriously, what do I want to devour in here?
Could it be... this, perhaps?
That's... is that... Lebkuchen? When did you find Lebkuchen?
I had someone pick it up for me while we were in port. Well, not for me, it's mostly for you.
Das isch alles für mich?! Excuse me, am I drooling? I feel like I'm drooling. Give them to me.
Calm down, it's not that easy. I wanted to make this assignment more fun for you. And what's more fun than a reward system?
I feel like I'm being treated like a pet...
Here, have one.
Mmmm, and I'm suddenly okay with that.
*ALARM*
Hey, if I blow up these Nixen, can I have another one?
Hmmm, we'll see.
@BATTLE
Back to writing, Nürnberg?
Ja. I'm trying. I'm still trying to decide my first page quote.
What have you got so far?
Was? I'm not going to tell you! That'd be embarrassing.

Fields.MenuText: Ya got nothing, huh?
Oh, come on, I'm your captain.
It's just a quote. What's embarrassing about a quote?

Fields.DialogueText: No. I've got plenty. You just don't need to know about it.
That doesn't mean I'm just going to tell you everything.
You can tell a lot about a person based on the quote they choose.
You know, if you're having trouble, you could always just quote me.
Ha, very funny, Kapitän.
Who says I was joking?
So sei es - I'll keep an ear out. If you say anything noteworthy, I'll consider using it as my quote. But I'm not going to hold my breath.
You sure know how to keep a captain humble, Nürnberg.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Nürnberg, were you just having an actual conversation with one of the medical officers?
Yeah, he actually... thanked me for my work in their storerooms. He said that it took a little time for him to get used to it, but now he sees the value in the changes I made.
Really? So you're okay with all of them now?
Nein, nein - überhaupt nicht. The rest of the medical staff still kind of hate me. But at least one of them admitted I was right.
Don't tell me you're going to go back to ignoring everyone else's suggestions now.
No, no, I know I could've handled that situation better. I'm just glad that the changes I made were helpful, even if the medics still don't like me.

Fields.MenuText: Don't worry, they just need a little more time.
And I thought I could hold a grudge.
Maybe we should throw them all overboard? That's one way to fix all this.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. You keep telling me that.
I would've expected medical professionals to be a little more... professional.
I know you're joking, Kapitän, but there are parts of that plan I know I would like.
*ALARM*
We've got company.
Well, let's take them on. I'm in a good mood now.
@BATTLE
That's our destination.
And I assume those are the Nixen we were sent here to deal with?

Fields.MenuText: Probably.
You sure?
No. I don't think so.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, what are we waiting for? Let's rush in and save the day.
I'm pretty sure. They're attacking the port, after all.
Really? So you think it's just a coincidence that they're attacking the harbor?
Okay, let's hurry to the battle. And Nürnberg? Be careful where you aim. We don't need to give our allies trouble.
I'll make sure my shots only land on the Nixen.
Actually, this is a good opportunity for us, Kapitän. We can prove to our allies that we're only here to help. It might be a good thing that the Nixen are attacking right now.
See, that's one of those things that I wouldn't repeat to them when we meet after the battle.
Oh, ich verstehe. Got it!
@BATTLE
And the next thing you can get is that pack of Morganas off to starboard. Fire at will, Nürnberg!
Nürnberg, you ready to meet with our allies and discuss our battle plans?
Öh, ähm, ja, nadürlich!
Just give me a second.
What are you messing with over there?
My battle plans. How I think we should proceed.
I hope you're ready to listen to what others have to say.
Of course. I'm keeping my mind open to other people's suggestions.

Fields.MenuText: I'll believe it when I see it.
That's good to hear.
Hmmm, maybe you really are changing.

Fields.DialogueText: Then let's get to that meeting.
I'm trying hard to see things from others' perspectives.
It's hard, but I'm trying.
*ALARM*
I thought we chased off all the Morganas.
Apparently there were a few stragglers. Shouldn't take us too long to take care of them.
Let's hope you're right.
@BATTLE
This is how we plan to handle the next raid now that we have your help. Any questions?
These plans make sense to me. Nürnberg?
Mhmmmm.
Your Belle has been fairly quiet. Is something wrong?

Fields.MenuText: No, she's always like that.
I think she might be coming down with a cold or something.
You can ask her yourself. She can answer on her own.

Fields.DialogueText: I see. Well, you know the Aloja better than I do.
Las Alojas get sick? Interesting. I had no idea.
Of course. I meant no offense to la Aloja.
Okay, I have to say one thing. I can't hold it in anymore.
Nobody asked you to hold it in, Nürnberg.
Sehr gut... It's unwise for us to sit on our hands and wait for the Nixen to attack again.
You want us to go after them ourselves? We don't have the numbers for that kind of operation.
No, I'm suggesting we leave some surprises in the water for the Nixen.
Ah, traps.
*ALARM*
Another raid already?
No, this is more than likely a scouting party. They pop in every once in a while to test our defenses.
Well, let's make sure we pass this test.
And then afterward, we can talk more about these traps of yours.
@BATTLE
So we fill the barrels with explosives and pitch or oil and then place them around the perimeter.
So not only will we be alerted to the Morganas' approach, but they'll also take a good hit when they cross that line.
Additionally, but the oil should catch fire on the water and keep the Nixen from rushing forward.

Fields.MenuText: Impressive.
You sure it'll work?
Sounds destructive. I like it.

Fields.DialogueText: Danke. I put a good deal of thought into it.
Ja. It should. If it doesn't, I'll cut off my own hand and eat it.
I like that glint in your eyes, Kapitän. Reminds me of myself.
There is one problem I have with this plan.
And that is?
That oil would make more of a mess than its worth. It would take a lot of time and manpower to clean it up after this is all over and done with.
This is war. We have to make some sacrifices.
I understand that, it's just--
Aaa! ... No, you're right. I shouldn't dismiss your suggestions like that... We can use the explosives and substitute the oil for more shrapnel and powder.
It would be a bigger bang. And could do more damage.
More damage to the Brujas and less damage to the water.
Okay. So... yeah, that'll work. Everybody happy?
I am.
Great. Now, let's get to work. We'll run a patrol to get any Morganas out of our hair before we start laying out the mines.
Great. We should have plenty of time to lay them all out. The next raid is still a ways off... we hope.
Still, no point in procrastinating. Let's go, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
Yikes, that's a little far, don't you think?
That's how sure I am.
*ALARM*
Your traps are coming along pretty nicely, huh?
We could be moving faster, but we're getting there. Though... I still think we should've gone with my plan.
I'm proud of you, though. You listened to someone else's suggestion.
Es war nicht leicht. Shouting was only just averted.

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, well... I'm not sure it'll ever be easy, exactly.
It'll get easier.
So why'd you do it?

Fields.DialogueText: That's the opposite of what I wanted to hear.
I hope so. I plan on staying this way, after all.
I'm trying to better myself. And I'd like to think I'm succeeding.
I'm still just worried about the next attack. I hope these mines will be enough.
They probably won't be. But don't forget that we're here too. Together, we'll be more than enough.
*BOOM*
What was that?!
Oh, no. It seems like we were wrong about the next attack. The Nixen are raiding... now.
*BOOM*
Well, at least the mines are working.
Not all of them. We haven't placed most of them yet. This won't be good.
We're still here, and we're not alone. We can fend them off.
Let's hope you're right.
@BATTLE
To battle stations! Schnell! Schnell!
@BATTLE
How are we doing?
We took some hits, but our allies are a lot worse off than us.
You're right. It looks like a few ships went down with the Morganas.
We should hurry to rescue any survivors.
Really? You're not going to argue that we should chase and destroy the Morganas while they're weak?
Is that really what you think of me, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: Of course not, let's hurry.
It was. But maybe I was wrong.
Sometimes. I have difficulty wrapping my head around you, Nürnberg.

Fields.DialogueText: Mhmmm. Yes, let's.
Let's hope so.
I'll take that as a compliment. Complexity can be a good thing.
*BOOM*
Was that a mine?
Oh, great. Looks as if one of our allies decided to give chase after the Nixen... and hit a mine. They're sinking now.
A...ha. You're a smart one, Nürnberg. It's a good thing we're here to help them.
And that's the last of them, Kapitän. All the mines are floating in the water. Mission ausgeführt!
Already? That was fast.
Well, I guess there might've been a bright side to the Nixen attacking so quickly. I got to see where they rush in from.

Fields.MenuText: I guess that is kind of a bright side.
Yeah, I'm not sure all the damage they dealt was worth it.
You're asking for trouble, Nürnberg. With that kind of talk, I wouldn't be surprised if they attacked again in a few seconds.

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly. I'm trying to be positive.
Well, I'm not saying that. I'm just trying to make the best of it, Kapitän.
They can feel free. They'd be welcomed by a wall of explosions.
We should run a patrol just to make sure some wandering ships don't set off your traps.
Or wandering Nixen. As much as they deserve to blow up, we need to save the surprise for the raiding party.
Exactly. Let's go.
@BATTLE
Our next contact is even faster than expected. Here they come!
Get us to battle stations, Nürnberg.
@BATTLE
Hey, Nürnberg, how secure is the perimeter?
What kind of question is that? Any ship that tries to pass in or out is going to be blown to bits. Why?
But we passed through to run patrol.
Ja, because I know where all the mines are. Any other ship would be full of holes.
And is there... any way to move them to create an opening?
What's going on, Kapitän? Ist etwas passiert?
I just received a request from our allies. They're not sure how long this will go on, and they'd like to continue trade. So...
They want me to leave a big gap in our defenses? How stupid can they be?!

Fields.MenuText: I know, it's ridiculous. I just thought I should check.
Hey, try to keep an open mind. See it from their perspective.
Trade is just as important as war, Nürnberg.

Fields.DialogueText: Ridiculous is right. I can't think of a more idiotic request for them to have at this point.
Ugh... There are times for compromise... and then there are times like these.
Ja, but it's sure as hell not as important as living.
I'm not going to leave a hole in our defenses. You can tell them to suck it up and deal with their lack of foreign trinkets or whatever.
I'm pretty sure they were more worried about food.
Rationing is a thing! It won't hurt them in the short term.
I guess I could be a little more sympathetic.
Maybe a little.
I just don't want the Nixen to utilize any holes I might leave for allies.
I understand, Nürnberg. And I think you're right. But I might break the news to our allies a little more... diplomatically than you would.
Ja. That's probably for the best.
Another pack of 'em, Nürnberg. Guns up!
Nürnberg, things are kicking off.
You haven't seen anything yet, Kapitän.
What are you talking about? Your mines have been set off. We should hurry to intercept the rest of the Morganas before they get too close to port.
Nicht so hastig! Just wait.

Fields.MenuText: There's no time to waste!
Okay... what do you have up your sleeve?
You want to just sit and wait? That's new.

Fields.DialogueText: We're not wasting any time. Just trust me, Kapitän.
It'll be more enjoyable if you see it for yourself.
You'll understand in drei... zwei... eins...
*BOOM*
Another round of explosions?
Weighted mines. Triggered to come up after the first set. I was curious to see if they'd work as designed.
You are scary sometimes, Nürnberg. You know that?
It wouldn't be the first time I've heard it. Now let's go make the Nixen feel the same.
@BATTLE
There are more? They didn't seem this strong before.
They probably weren't sending their best before. Now they have to. Their worst is nothing more than refuse, thanks to us.

Fields.MenuText: I hope we can handle this...
I'm guessing you have some more tricks up your sleeve for these guys?
Sounds like a good thing. This will be the end of them now, for sure.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, don't give up so soon, Kapitän. Have some faith in us.
Hee. You know me too well, Kapitän.
My thoughts exactly. Let's obliterate them, Kapitän!
You know, you've got that creepy smile thing going on again, Nürnberg.
I'd have thought you'd be used to it by now.
Not yet, but if it helps get us through this last fight, smile however you want.
@BATTLE
Is it really so creepy?
Maybe I should have said that has a certain... intensity.
You should have, but you didn't.
Nürnberg, what are you doing in here? We did it, and you should be out here celebrating with the rest of us.
I'll be out in a minute. I'm just writing down everything I don't want to forget about this mission of ours.
Look at that, you're writing up a storm there. And here I was, thinking you were still stuck on a quote.
I'm actually still working on that, but I didn't want it to keep me from writing about this adventure.
Can I get a peek?
You already read the entirety of my previous Wanderbuch. Wasn't that enough for you?
What can I say? I'm curious.
Nadürlich. Maybe I will share it with you. Someday.

Fields.MenuText: I'll be patient, then.
Oh, come on. Why not today?
Never mind, I don't want to read it anyway.

Fields.DialogueText: Good. It's a virtue, after all.
Because I'm still writing it today. Don't be annoying.
Not curious anymore? Fine, I'll keep it to myself. It is a journal, after all.
All right, I think that's a good place to finish for now.
Ready to join the party then?
Sure, but before we go... I just wanted to thank you.
Thank me?
You're a pretty good Kapitän.
Well, gee, thanks.
But you're a great friend. I know I have my issues, but I'm working on them and you're sticking with me. It means a lot.
Whatever issues you may or may not have, you're not nearly as hard-headed as you used to be.
And that has a lot to do with you. So here.
You're... gonna let me read it?
Don't get too excited. It's just a page or two of what we just went through. I mean, you experienced it yourself.
There's something different about seeing it from your perspective.
Whatever you say. Now, come on, you can read the rest later. We've got a celebration to get to!
Gladly.
One more pack of Morganas, Nürnberg. Got anything left?
Would my answer change reality? I think not.
@BATTLE
